name: European walking route E2, UK, Dover-Calais ferry

ai.summary: A hard coastal section of the European walking route E2 in the UK, spanning 49 km around the Dover area. The route includes a Channel ferry crossing from Dover to Calais, which is not walked. Expect exposed cliff paths, headlands, and variable tides; plan multi-day trekking with careful weather and ferry timing.
ai.terrain_summary: Coastal terrain with clifftop paths, chalk cliffs, shingle beaches, and occasional road sections. Expect exposed winds, uneven footing, and possible slippery surfaces near the shore; navigation relies on maps and markers along the coast.
ai.safety_notes: Check ferry schedules and book in advance for the Dover–Calais crossing; the Channel crossing is by ferry and not part of the hike. Monitor tide times, weather, and wind forecasts; coastal paths can be exposed and slippery, especially after rain. Wear sturdy footwear, carry a charged phone and map, and inform someone of your plan and expected return. In case of poor conditions, be prepared to shorten or pause the hike and seek shelter.
recommended_gear: Weatherproof, windproof jacket and insulating layer
Water bottle or hydration bladder (2–3 L) and snacks
Headlamp or flashlight with extra batteries
First aid kit and blister care
Whistle, emergency blanket or bivy, and personal identification
Sun protection (hat, sunscreen) and a phone charger
ai.best_seasons: May–September for the best weather and daylight; shoulder seasons (April, October) can be workable with caution due to variable conditions.

seo.title: E2 UK Dover to Calais: 49 km Coastal Trek on the European Walking Route
seo.meta_description: Plan a challenging 49 km segment of the E2 in the UK near Dover, including the Dover–Calais ferry crossing. Practical gear, safety tips, and best seasons for the hike.
seo.h1: E2 UK Dover to Calais Coastal Trek (49 km)
